gravity_system: W14x30 Beams, W10x33 Columns, Concrete Deck, HSS4x4x1/4 Bracing
key_elements: Anchor Bolts, Wall Plate to Beam Connection, Column to Beam Connection, Beam to Bearing Plate Connection
overall_building_description: The PFI Boiler Room project involves a roof structure primarily supported by W10x33 columns and W14x30 beams, with additional support from HSS4x4x1/4 bracing. The roof framing plan indicates the use of concrete on a 1 1/2"x0.030" hi-bond metal deck, reinforced with 10M bars at 12 inches on center each way, achieving a total thickness of 6 inches. The roof framing sections, labeled as Section 1 and Section 2, depict the load transfer from the roof deck through the beams to the columns, with a typical spacing of 4'-6" and a span of 12'-9 1/2". The sections also highlight the top of steel and existing floor levels, with a 1 1/2" grout layer specified for leveling and load distribution. The wall plate to beam connection detail, labeled WP1, involves a W14x22 beam connected to a wall plate using 4-3/4" diameter Nelson studs embedded in 8" poured concrete, with a PL3/8x3 x 8 1/2 plate and 3-3/4" diameter bolts for assembly. Anchor bolt details AL1 and AL2 specify the use of 4-3/4" diameter anchor bolts, 2'-0" long with double nuts, set on a concrete pier with a 1 1/2" grout layer, ensuring stability and load transfer at critical points. The beam to bearing plate connection detail, labeled BP1, involves a W14x22 beam connected to an 8-inch concrete block using a stiffener plate with a thickness of 3/8 inches, with weld symbols indicating a 1/4-inch weld on three sides. The column to beam connection detail specifies a W14x30 beam and a W10x33 column, with 2-L3x3x3/8 angles and a bolt assembly of 3-3/4 inch diameter bolts, achieving a connection capacity of Vr = 255 KN. The steel notes emphasize compliance with CSA standards for structural steel, specifying A325 structural bolts and welding requirements per CSA W59, with all structural steel shop primed and hardware torqued by the turn of the nut method as per S16-19 23.7.2 & Table 7. The anchor plan provides grid references and dimensions for precise column placement, with a compass rose indicating orientation. The project requires field verification of all dimensions prior to manufacturing, ensuring adherence to design specifications and structural integrity. The integration of new and existing elements is addressed in Section 3, which includes a W14x22 beam, L6x6x3/8 angle, and existing brick veneer, with repair as required. The project emphasizes the importance of precise fabrication and installation procedures, with detailed specifications for material grades, connection types, and load transfer mechanisms, ensuring compliance with structural standards and safety requirements.
